Actual Text: title: Ragi Semiya Upma Recipe - Ragi Millet Vermicelli Breakfast section> ingredients: 1-1/2 cups Rice Vermicelli Noodles (Thin) sep> 1 Onion - sliced sep> 1/2 cup Carrots (Gajjar) - chopped sep> 1/3 cup Green peas (Matar) sep> 2 Green Chillies sep> 1/4 teaspoon Asafoetida (hing) sep> 1 teaspoon Mustard seeds sep> 1 teaspoon White Urad Dal (Split) sep> 1 teaspoon Ghee sep> 1 sprig Curry leaves sep> Salt - to taste sep> 1 teaspoon Lemon juice section> directions: To begin making the Ragi Vermicelli Recipe, first steam the ragi vermicelli in a rice cooker or a steamer for about 5-6 minutes or till it is cooked but firm sep> Keep aside this aside till later use sep> You can add a few drops of oil and mix it so that they don't stick to each other sep> Place a kadai on the heat, add the ghee or oil to it and when warm add hing and allow it to sizzle for 30 seconds sep> Then follow it up with mustard seeds, urad dal and curry leaves, and allow them to crackle sep> Saute for 1 minute or so till the urad dal is slightly browned sep> Then, add onions and fry till translucent and soft sep> Next, add the green chillies along with par boiled carrots and peas sep> Sprinkle some salt and cook for 2-3 minutes or until the vegetables are semi cooked sep> Then, add the steamed ragi vermicelli toss it together so the vegetables are all well combined sep> Switch off the heat, take the vermicelli out into a serving dish and to with lemon juice sep> Mix well and serve along with Coconut Chutney and a hot cup of coffee or tea for a wholesome breakfast sep>

Actual Text: title: Saunf Aloo (Fennel Potato Curry) Recipe section> ingredients: 5 Potatoes (Aloo) - halved with skin sep> 2 teaspoon Fennel seeds (Saunf) - crushed sep> 2 teaspoon Red Chilli powder sep> 1 teaspoon Turmeric powder (Haldi) sep> 1/4 cup Fresh cream - or 1/2 cup milk sep> 4 sprig Coriander (Dhania) Leaves - finely chopped section> directions: To begin with Saunf Aloo, heat oil in a pressure cooker sep> Add turmeric powder, salt, red chilli powder and crushed fennel seeds till the fennel seeds turns golden in colour sep> Now add the potatoes and mix it properly with the masala sep> Sauce it for 2-3 minutes and then add enough water to cover the potatoes in the cooker sep> Switch the heat after two whistles and once the pressure is released, open the lid of the pressure cooker sep> The next step is to add the cream or milk and mash a few potatoes to get a thicker consistency sep> Let it cook for 5 more minutes or until the cooker releases 2 more whistles sep> Garnish the Saunf Aloo with some roasted saunf and chopped coriander sep> Serve Sauf Aloo along with Amritsari Dal and Whole Wheat lachha Paratha for a weekday meal sep>

Actual Text: title: Garlic Amla Chutney Recipe - Lehsun Amla Chutney Recipe section> ingredients: 8 amla sep> 6 small onions sep> 10 bud garlic sep> 2 green chillies sep> 1/2 cup mint sep> 1/2 cup coriander sep> salt - as per taste sep> 1 tsp oil sep> 1 tsp oil sep> 1/2 tsp rye sep> 1/4 tsp urad dal sep> 1/4 tsp chana dal sep> 1 sprig curry leaves sep> 10 cashew nuts section> directions: To make Garlic Amla Chutney Recipe, first wash the amla, cut and remove the seeds sep> Now wash the mint, green coriander and keep it aside sep> Now heat oil in a pan sep> Add small onion, garlic and cook the onion after it becomes soft sep> Now add amla, mint, green coriander and cook it for 2 minutes sep> Turn off the gas sep> Allow this mixture to cool sep> Pour this mixture in the mixer grinder with salt, a little water and make a paste sep> Keep it separately sep> For tempering, now heat oil in a tempering pan sep> Add the mustard seeds, chana dal, urad dal, curry leaves, cashews and cook until cashew is light brown sep> Add this tempering to the chutney and mix sep> Mix well and serve sep> Serve Garlic Amla Chutney Recipe with Ghee Roast Dosa and Filter Coffee for breakfast sep>

Actual Text: title: Maharashtrian Kakdi Thalipeeth Recipe - Spiced Cucumber Flat Bread section> ingredients: 1/2 cup Gram flour (besan) sep> 1/2 cup Whole Wheat Flour sep> 1/4 cup Rice flour sep> 1 Cucumber - peeled and grated sep> 1 teaspoon Turmeric powder (Haldi) sep> 1 teaspoon Cumin powder (Jeera) sep> 1 teaspoon Coriander Powder (Dhania) sep> 1 teaspoon Red Chilli powder sep> 2 Green Chillies - finely chopped sep> 1/2 cup Coriander (Dhania) Leaves - chopped sep> 5 cloves Garlic - finely chopped sep> Salt - to taste sep> Ghee - for smearing on thalipeeth section> directions: To begin making the Maharashtrian Kakdi Thalipeeth Recipe, in a large mixing bowl add all the 3 flours together and mix them sep> Add all the remaining ingredients like the grated cucumber, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, green chillies, coriander leaves, garlic and salt to taste sep> Mix everything well and add a little water at a time to make a smooth and firm dough of the Kakdi Thalipeeth sep> The cucumber will release water when it gets combined with salt, so take care to add little water at a time sep> The dough will be slightly sticky to handle sep> Allow the dough to rest for 5 minutes sep> Divide the dough into 4 portions sep> Preheat the skillet on medium heat sep> Keep water in a separate bowl to wet fingers and to wet a muslin cloth sep> Spread a wet muslin cloth on a smooth counter top sep> Take a portion of the Kakdi Thalipeeth mixture and pat it on the wet cloth to about 4 inches in diameter sep> Try not to make it too thin as it can break while flipping it on the skillet sep> Carefully lift the cloth along with the patted mixture and flip the Thalipeeth over on the skillet sep> Drizzle a teaspoon of oil or ghee around the Thalipeeth and cook on medium heat sep> After about 3 minutes, you will be able to flip the Kakdi Thalipeeth over to the other side sep> Allow each side to cook on medium heat for about 3-4 minutes, until the Thalipeeth are slightly crisp and browned sep> Remove from heat and place on a serving platter sep> Continue the same procedure with the other portions of the Kakdi Thalipeeth dough sep> Serve the Maharashtrian Kakdi Thalipeeth along with Homemade Yogurt or lahsun chutney for breakfast sep>

Actual Text: title: South Indian Style Murungakkai Poriyal Recipe - Drumstick Stir Fry section> ingredients: 5 Drumstick - cut into 3 inch pieces sep> 1/2 cup Fresh coconut - grated sep> 2 Green Chillies - slit sep> 1 sprig Curry leaves sep> 1 teaspoon Mustard seeds sep> 2 teaspoons Coconut Oil sep> 2 Dry Red Chillies sep> 1/2 teaspoon Turmeric powder (Haldi) sep> Salt - to taste sep> Water - as needed section> directions: To begin making Murungakkai Poriyal Recipe, wash the drumsticks well & peel them by removing the tough green part sep> Cut them in 2 inches length sep> Take about glass of water in a kadhi, bring it to a boil, add these drumsticks with salt, turmeric powder (optional) & lightly steam them for 5-8 minutes sep> Be careful not to overcook the drumsticks sep> It should be tender but not mushy as in sambar or avial sep> Drain the water, keep the steamed drumsticks aside to cool slightly sep> Grate the coconut, add the green chillies & grind them well in a mixer sep> In the kadai, add coconut oil, once hot, add the mustard seeds, let it crackle sep> Then add the dry red chillies, curry leaves & add the steamed drumsticks sep> Mix everything well & let it cook for a minute sep> Add the grated coconut & give it one last stir sep> Serve Murungakkai Poriyal Recipe along with Kerala Avial Recipe, Steamed Rice Recipe and Malabar Style Dates Pickle Recipe for a complete meal sep>

Actual Text: title: Asian Style Sweet & Spicy Green Beans Recipe section> ingredients: 300 grams Green beans (French Beans) - cut into half sep> 3 cloves Garlic - finely chopped sep> 1 tablespoon Soy sauce sep> 2 tablespoons Thai Sweet Chilli Sauce sep> 1 Lemon - juice sep> 2 tablespoons Rice Wine Vinegar sep> 1/4 cup Roasted Peanuts (Moongphali) sep> Salt - to taste sep> 1 tablespoon Sesame (Gingelly) Oil section> directions: To begin making the Asian Style Sweet & Spicy Green Beans Recipe, firstly add the green beans into a pressure cooker with salt to taste and 2 tablespoons of water sep> Pressure cook the beans for one whistle and release the pressure immediately and keep aside sep> We release the pressure immediately, so the greens remain green and fresh,Our next step is to stir fry the green beans in Asian sauces sep> Preheat heat oil in a pan over medium heat; once the oil is hot add the cloves and saute for a few seconds until the aromas come through sep> At this stage, add the soy sauce, thai sweet chilli sauce, rice wine vinegar, and lemon juice and stir to combine sep> Add the cooked beans and roasted peanuts to the above sauce mixture sep> Stir fry on high heat for 3 to 4 minutes till the beans and the peanuts are well coated with the sweet and spicy sauce sep> Once done, check the salt and spices and adjust to taste accordingly sep> Once done, turn off the heat and transfer the Asian Style Sweet & Spicy Green Beans to a serving bowl and serve hot sep> Serve Asian Style Sweet & Spicy Green Beans Recipe with steaming hot Thai Jasmine Sticky Rice and Thai Pineapple Vegetarian Curry for a delicious meal sep>

Actual Text: title: Chettinad Style Chicken Roast Recipe section> ingredients: 1 Chicken legs sep> 1/4 cup Hung Curd (Greek Yogurt) sep> 1/2 teaspoon Turmeric powder (Haldi) sep> Salt - to taste sep> 1 teaspoon Sunflower Oil sep> 1 Onion - sliced sep> 4 cloves Garlic sep> 1/2 inch Ginger sep> 2 tablespoon Fresh coconut - grated sep> 2 teaspoon Cumin seeds (Jeera) sep> 2 teaspoons Coriander (Dhania) Seeds sep> 1/4 teaspoon Methi Seeds (Fenugreek Seeds) sep> 1/4 teaspoon Kalonji (Onion Nigella Seeds) sep> 1 teaspoon Whole Black Peppercorns sep> 2 Dry Red Chillies sep> 1 teaspoon Fennel seeds (Saunf) sep> 1/2 inch Cinnamon Stick (Dalchini) sep> 2 Cloves (Laung) sep> 1 Cardamom (Elaichi) Pods/Seeds sep> 1/2 teaspoon Mustard seeds sep> 1 tablespoon Ghee sep> 1 teaspoon Tamarind Paste sep> 1 teaspoon Jaggery sep> 1 teaspoon Ghee sep> 1/2 teaspoon Mustard seeds sep> 1 sprig Curry leaves sep> 4 cloves Garlic section> directions: To begin making the Chettinad Style Chicken Roast Recipe, thoroughly wash and clean the chicken leg sep> Keep it aside sep> Heat oil in a heavy bottomed pan, on medium flame sep> Add onions, coconut, ginger and garlic and cook till the onions become soft and the coconut turn light brown in colour sep> Turn off the flame and grind to a coarse paste with a little water in a mixer grinder sep> The next step is to marinate the chicken sep> In a mixing bowl, add the onion coconut paste, yogurt, turmeric powder and chicken legs sep> Mix everything well and ensure that the chicken is properly quoted with the masala sep> Keep it aside for 30 Minutes sep> For the Chettinad Spice MixHeat a heavy bottomed pan sep> Add chettinad spice mix ingredients - includes cumin seeds, coriander seeds, fenugreek seeds, kalonji, black peppercorn, dry red chillies, fennel seeds, cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom and mustard seeds sep> Dry roast them for about 2 minutes sep> Once done, let it cool down a bit sep> Now, add thes spices into a mixer grinder and grind it into a powder sep> Heat ghee in the same pan and add this Chettinad spice mix into the ghee sep> After 30 seconds, add the chicken along with all the marinade sep> Mix everything well, add the tamarind pulp, jaggery and 1/4 cup of water sep> Cover the pan and cook for about 8 to 10 minutes or till the chicken is 3/4th done sep> Turn off flame sep> Take out the chicken pieces seperatly and keep the masala aside sep> Heat a grill pan on high heat, until smoking hot and place only the chicken leg on it sep> Let this get a nice crispy skin by cooking it for about 5-7 minutes on each side sep> Once done, turn off the heat and keep the chicken piece on a plate sep> The final step is to temper the chicken sep> To make the tempering, heat ghee in a tadka pan on medium flame sep> Add mustard seeds, curry leaves and allow it to crackle sep> Add the chopped garlic and fry till golden brown sep> Turn off the flame

Actual Text: title: Peerkangai Thogayal Recipe (Ridge Gourd Peel Chutney) section> ingredients: 2 cups Ridge Gourd Skin (Turai/ Peerkangai) sep> 2 teaspoons White Urad Dal (Split) sep> 5 Methi Seeds (Fenugreek Seeds) sep> 3 Dry Red Chillies sep> 10 Curry leaves sep> 30 grams Tamarind sep> 1/4 teaspoon Mustard seeds sep> 2 Dry Red Chillies sep> 3-4 Curry leaves sep> 1 teaspoon Sunflower Oil sep> Salt - to taste section> directions: To begin making the Peerkangai Thogayal Recipe, heat a teaspoon oil in a heavy bottomed pan; add the cut peels of the Ridge Gourd, along with a little salt and saute until soft and tender sep> Turn off heat and allow it to cool sep> The peels will not get completely soft, so its ok as long as they have cooked through sep> In another small pan; roast the fenugreek seeds, dry red chillies and urad dal until it releases a roasted aroma and slightly browned sep> Now grind the roasted ingredients, the cooked ridge gourd peels, the tamarind and curry leaves together until it forms a smooth paste sep> Check the salt in the Peerkangai Thogayal Recipe and adjust to suit your taste sep> Heat a little oil in a pan; add mustard seeds, dry red chillies and curry leaves sep> Allow it to crackle and the red chillies to roast sep> Add it to the Peerkangai Thogayal sep> Serve the Peerkangai Thogayal along with a hot bowl of Steamed Rice and Ghee sep>

Actual Text: title: Dalia Pakora Recipe - Dalia Pakora Recipe section> ingredients: 1 cup Broken Wheat (Dalia/ Godumai Rava) sep> Salt - to taste sep> 1/2 teaspoon Sunflower Oil sep> 1/3 cup Gram flour (besan) sep> 1 Onion - finely chopped sep> 1/4 cup Coriander (Dhania) Leaves - finely chopped sep> 1 Green Chilli - finely chopped sep> Salt - to taste sep> 1/2 teaspoon Turmeric powder (Haldi) sep> 1/2 teaspoon Cumin seeds (Jeera) sep> 1/2 teaspoon Ajwain (Carom seeds) sep> 1 tablespoon Sunflower Oil sep> Water - as required to make a thick pakora batter sep> 1 teaspoon Enos fruit salt sep> Sunflower Oil - as required to fry the pakoras section> directions: To make Oatmeal Pakora Recipe, we will first cook Dalia sep> Wash the panel and keep it aside sep> In a pressure cooker, add 2 cups of water, a little salt, oil, Dalia and mix sep> Close the pressure cooker and cook until 4 to 5 come to the city sep> Turn off the gas and let the pressure drain automatically sep> Open the cooker and if there is still water left then keep stirring on high heat and cook until all the water is gone sep> Take out the cooked pak in a large bowl and keep it aside to cool sep> After cooling, add gram flour, onion, coriander, green chillies, salt, turmeric powder, cumin, celery, oil, water and make a thick batter sep> Add ino fruit salt to it and mix sep> Now heat a paniyaram pan sep> Add oil to each cavity and after the oil is heated add a little oatmeal batter sep> Cook until golden brown and crisp from all sides sep> Serve sep> You can also fry these pakodas in a pan sep> Serve the dalia pakora recipe with coriander mint chutney and tamarind chutney sep> You can also serve a hot cup of masala tea with it sep>

Actual Text: title: Beetroot Sambar Recipe section> ingredients: 1 chakundar - peel and chop sep> 1 cup arhar dal sep> 1-1 / 2 cup tamarind water sep> 1 tablespoon sambar powder sep> 1 teaspoon mustard sep> asafoetida - a pinch sep> 5 curry leaves - chopped sep> 1 dry red chili sep> 1 teaspoon sesame oil sep> 4 sprig coriander - chopped (for garnish) sep> salt - as per taste section> directions: To make Chakundar Sambar, firstly, put the tur dal in the cooker with 2 cups of water and cook it till 3 cities come sep> If you find the lentils thick, add a little more water to it and mix well sep> Now in a pressure cooker, add tamarind water, salt and sambar powder along with chakundar sep> Turn off the cooker and cook till 3 cities come sep> Turn off the gas and let the pressure drain automatically sep> Now add chakundar mixture, tur dal, salt and mix in a saucepan sep> Keep it to boil sep> Now heat the oil for tempering sep> Add mustard seeds and dry red chilies sep> After 10 seconds, add curry leaves, asafoetida and turn off the gas sep> Add this tempering to the sambar and mix sep> Garnish with green coriander and serve sep> Serve the Chakundar Sambar with potato roast and rice for dinner sep>

Actual Text: title: Vegan Chickpea Omelette Recipe (Spiced Chickpea Flour Pancakes) section> ingredients: 1 cup Gram flour (besan) sep> 1/2 cup Coconut milk sep> 3/4 cup Water sep> 1 inch Ginger - grated sep> 2 cloves Garlic - grated sep> 1/2 teaspoon Ajwain (Carom seeds) sep> 1/4 teaspoon Asafoetida (hing) sep> 1/4 teaspoon Turmeric powder (Haldi) sep> 1/4 teaspoon Baking soda sep> 2-3 Green Chillies - finely chopped sep> 1 Onion - finely chopped sep> 1 Tomato - finely chopped sep> Coriander (Dhania) Leaves - A handful finely chopped sep> Salt - to taste sep> Sunflower Oil - for cooking section> directions: To begin making the Vegan Chickpea Omelette Recipe, first place a non-stick griddle/tava on the heat sep> Turn the heat to low so it can slowly pre-heat while you prepare the batter sep> To make the batter, sieve the chickpea flour/besan into a mixing bowl to remove all lumps sep> To it, add the ginger-garlic paste, ajwain, asafoetida, turmeric powder, baking soda, onion, tomato, green chillies, Coriander leaves and salt sep> Mix well to combine sep> Next, stir in the coconut milk (or Soy or Almond milk), if using, and mix to make a smooth batter sep> Alternatively, add enough water to make a batter which is smooth and spreadable, but not too watery/runny sep> When the griddle is hot enough, pour a ladle full of the batter on it and spread evenly into a round pancake sep> Drizzle oil along the edges of the omelette and cook for 2-3 minutes, on medium heat till the bottom is golden brown sep> Lift it gently with a spatula to check if it releases and if that bottom has cooked sep> When it looks golden, flip the omelette over and cook on the other side for 1-2 minutes sep> Serve hot along with Peanut Carrot Chutney sep>

Actual Text: title: Mango Donut Cake Recipe With Chocolate Glaze section> ingredients: 1-1/2 cups Vivatta Maida sep> 3/4 cup Mango Pulp (Puree) sep> 1-1/2 teaspoons Baking powder sep> 1/4 teaspoon Baking soda sep> 1/4 cup Sunflower Oil sep> 1/4 cup Sugar sep> 1/4 teaspoon Salt sep> 1 teaspoon Vanilla Extract sep> 150 grams Dark chocolate - chopped sep> 1/4 cup Fresh cream sep> 2 tablespoons Cocoa Powder sep> 3 Sugar - powdered section> directions: To begin making the Mango Donut Cake Recipe With Chocolate Glaze, preheat the oven to 180 deg C sep> Grease a donut (doughnut) pan with oil or line up with butter paper sep> Sift the maida baking powder, baking soda and salt in a bowl sep> Mix everything and keep it aside sep> In a mixing bowl, take mango puree along with sugar sep> Mix well until sugar dissolves completely sep> Next add oil, vanilla essence and mix well again sep> Add the mango mixture into the sifted dry flour mixture, fold gently until a smooth batter texture sep> Now pour the Mango donut cake batter equally into the donut pan slots sep> Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven at 180 degree C sep> Take the Mango Donut Cake from the oven and let them cool down a bit sep> While the Mango Donut Cake is baking, add the chocolates and the cream into the saucepan sep> Melt the dark chocolate until you get a smooth Chocolate Glaze sep> Once the Mango Donut Cake is done, remove from the pan and allow it to cool sep> Once cooled, hold the mango donut cake upside down, dip the top surface of the cake in the glaze and pull it up sep> Let the extra glaze dribble and then immediately turn glaze side up and keep on a cooling rack for the glaze to harden sep> Repeat this process for rest of the Mango Donut Cake sep> Serve the donut cake after the glaze hardens sep> Serve Mango Donut Cake Recipe With Chocolate Glaze along with Grilled Stuffed Mushrooms Recipe With Onion Parmesan & Herbs, Heart Shaped Tea Sandwiches and Adrak Chai for your next tea party sep>

Actual Text: title: Thengai Sadam Recipe (A Quick and Healthy Coconut Rice) section> ingredients: 1 cup Fresh coconut - grated sep> 2-1/2 cups Cooked rice sep> 1 teaspoon Mustard seeds sep> 2 teaspoons White Urad Dal (Split) sep> 2 teaspoons Chana dal (Bengal Gram Dal) sep> 1 Raw Peanuts (Moongphali) - fistful sep> 1 sprig Curry leaves sep> 3 or 4 Green Chillies - finely chopped sep> 1 teaspoon Ginger - grated sep> 1 + 1 tablespoon Coconut Oil sep> Salt - to taste section> directions: To begin cooking the Thengai Sadam (Coconut Rice Recipe), heat a tablespoon of coconut oil in a heavy bottomed pan or wok sep> Add the mustard seeds to the oil, and once it begins to crackle, add in the urad dal, channa dal and the peanuts sep> Once the dals begins to brown, add the green chillies, curry leaves and ginger and stir them together for a few minutes sep> Next, add in the coconut to the kadai and mix them all together sep> Care should be taken to avoid any moisture remaining in the mixture, therefore keep stirring it properly until all the moisture in the coconut evaporates sep> At this stage, stir in the cooked rice and salt and combine all the ingredients well sep> Add a tablespoon of coconut oil to it to separate the grains of the rice sep> Finally, add a tablespoon of coconut oil to the Thengai Sadam, to separate the grains of the rice sep> Stir fry gently to combine all the ingredient taking care and ensuring that the rice does not get mashed, in the process sep> Once combined, turn the heat to low and simmer for a couple of minutes sep> Turn off the heat and serve the Thengai Sadam (Coconut Rice) hot with a potato roast and papad sep>

Actual Text: title: White Pumpkin Mor Kuzhambu Recipe - Kerala Style White Pumpkin Curry section> ingredients: 1-1/2 cups Curd (Dahi / Yogurt) - thick sep> 1/2 cup Fresh coconut sep> 1 cup Vellai Poosanikai (Ash gourd/White Pumpkin) - cubed sep> 4 Green Chillies sep> 1/4 teaspoon Black pepper powder sep> 1/3 cup Water sep> 1/4 teaspoon Turmeric powder (Haldi) sep> Salt - as per your taste sep> 1 teaspoon Coconut Oil sep> 1/4 teaspoon Mustard seeds sep> 1/4 teaspoon Methi Seeds (Fenugreek Seeds) sep> 1 sprig Curry leaves sep> 1 Dry Red Chilli section> directions: To begin making White Pumpkin Mor Kuzhambu, we need to first cook the pumpkin sep> Pressure cook the white pumpkin with little water in a pressure cooker for 2 whistles and release the pressure immediately by running the cooker under cold water sep> Keep aside sep> Meanwhile, whisk curd with water in a bowl until the its smooth sep> Make sure that there are no lumps in the curd sep> Next, add grated coconut, green chilli, black pepper powder in a mixer grinder and grind it to a smooth paste with a little water sep> Your Kuzhambu paste is ready sep> Transfer this kuzhambu paste to the curd and mix well sep> Once it is mixed properly, add in turmeric powder, cooked white pumpkin, salt and mix everything well sep> Place this mixture on low heat in a saucepan and allow the mixture to become warm sep> You will notice a light froth around the edges of the vessel sep> Do not let the mixture boil, the curd will split on high heat sep> Turn off the flame the moment you see froth sep> The next step is to temper the kuzhambu sep> In a tempering pan/tadka pan, add one teaspoon of coconut oil sep> Once the oil is hot, add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds, Once the mustard seeds starts to crackle, add the curry leaves, dry red chilli and give it a mix sep> Turn off the flame and add this tempering to the Mor Kuzhambu sep> Your Mor Kuzhambu is ready to be served sep> Serve Mor Kuzhambu with Steamed Rice and Menthia Keerai Paruppu Usili for a simple weekday lunch sep>

drops of lemon juice and 2-3 pinch salt sep> Mix well and marinate for 15-20 minutes sep> Wash and soak rice in water for a minimum 30 minutes before cooking sep> Heat oil in a large and thick bottomed handi and add the whole spices and wait till they splutter sep> Now add shallots and saute them till they are pale in color sep> Add green chili paste, grated coconut and marinated prawns and mix well sep> Fry for 4-5 minutes and then slowly add curd and carefully mix everything to avoid breaking the prawns sep> Keep the flames high and let the water from curd dry up completely sep> Season Biryani hot with raita for a wholesome meal sep>

as per taste sep> 1 bay leaf sep> 1/4 cup onion - bottom Take sep> 1 sprig of green coriander sep> 1 sprig of mint sep> 200 grams of cottage cheese - cut into 1/2 inch cube sep> 2 tomatoes sep> 2 tablespoons cream sep> 1 onion - oil sep> as per taste - As per use sep> 1 tbsp cashews - for garnish section> directions: To make Paneer Butter Masala Biryani recipe, first wash the rice and soak it for 30 minutes sep> To make rice for biryani, heat ghee in a pressure cooker sep> Add cardamom, long, star anise, cinnamon, whole black pepper, bay leaves, and cook for 1 minute sep> Now add rice, salt, 2 cups of water and close the cooker sep> Cook till 2 cities come and turn off the gas sep> Allow the pressure to drain automatically sep> Open the cooker and spread out the rice in a plate so that it becomes slightly cold sep> Now add fried onions, coriander leaves, mint and mix well sep> Keep it aside sep> To make Paneer Butter Masala for Biryani, heat oil in a pan sep> Add cumin, cardamom, green chillies, ginger, garlic, onion and cook till the onion turns brown sep> Now add tomatoes, salt and turn off the gas sep> Allow to cool sep> Now put this mixture in a mixer grinder and grind it into a paste sep> Heat some oil in a pan sep> Add the ground spices to it and cook for 1 minute sep> After this, add cumin powder, garam masala powder, red chili powder, honey, kasoori methi and let it cook on low flame sep> After the gravy boils, add cottage cheese, cream and mix it sep> Turn off the gas after 1 minute sep> To make biryani, grease a large bowl with butter sep> Add fried onions, mint leaves, coriander sep> Make a rice layer over it sep> Press it well sep> Now add Paneer Butter Masala to it sep> Re-insert these layers and place the rice on the topmost layer sep> Now place a plate over it and reverse it sep> Serve sep> Serve Paneer Butter Masala Biryani Recipe along with Bundi Raita and Papad for dinner sep>

Actual Text: title: Gond Ke Ladoo Recipe - Edible Gum Ladoo section> ingredients: 150 grams Goond (Edible Gum) sep> 350 grams Ghee sep> 400 grams Whole Wheat Flour sep> 400 grams Sugar - powdered sep> 50 grams Dry coconut (kopra) sep> 50 grams Badam (Almond) - chopped sep> 50 grams Cashew nuts - chopped section> directions: To begin making Gond Ke Ladoo, in a large and heavy bottomed pan, add 350 ml ghee and melt it on a low flame sep> Once the ghee is hot and melted, add gond/edible gum in the pan little at a time and fry on low flame until the goond puffs up like popcorn and crisps up sep> Make sure that goond is completely cooked from inside and outside sep> Repeat process with rest of the goond sep> Once goond is fried, using a ladle spoon out the goond from the ghee and keep aside to cool down sep> Into the same pan containing the melted ghee, add whole wheat flour and roast until it becomes aromatic and brown sep> The mixture should be crumbly sep> Turn off the flame sep> Transfer the flour on to a plate sep> Add the powdered sugar and all dry fruits and mix well sep> Let the mixture cool down sep> Meanwhile, once the goond has cooled, with a rolling pin, crush them into a coarse powder sep> Add this crushed goond in to wheat and dry fruit flour mixture sep> Now take little amount of mixture in your hands and give them round shape sep> Small or big that is totally up to you sep> Keep them aside for few hours, it will help the ladoos to set properly sep> You can keep them in airtight container for a month sep> Serve Gond Ke Ladoo as a healthy snack during winter to ward off flus and colds or to new mothers after delivery to provide them with instant energy and aid in lactation sep>
